category: Marketing Regulations/Article 14 (Marketing of member sports organizations and provincial/provincial sports associations)
contents: Article 14 (Marketing of member sports organizations and provincial/provincial sports associations) ① Member sports organizations and provincial/provincial sports associations may conduct their own marketing business to the extent that they do not infringe on the rights of sports associations under these regulations. ② The commercial rights of marketing assets are the rights of the sports association, and when the member sports association and the provincial/provincial sports association independently select a commercial rights holder and enter into a contract, they must ensure that the marketing assets and commercial rights of the sports association are not infringed.
